excerpt: Stately museum exhibiting archaeological finds, cultural objects & art from the Patna area.
detail_description: The Patna Museum is a must-visit for history enthusiasts, showcasing an impressive collection of artifacts from the Rajput and Mughal eras. With over seventy-five thousand antiquities, including stone sculptures, terracotta, and coins from the British era, the museum offers a comprehensive look at India's rich cultural heritage. Its unique architectural style reflects Indo-Saracenic influences. The museum's highlights include the Geological gallery, Dr.
name: Patna Museum
address: Buddh Marg, Lodipur, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

excerpt: This large, stupa-style granary, completed in 1786, offers sweeping city views from the top.
detail_description: Golghar, a stupa-style granary completed in 1786, is a prominent tourist attraction in Patna. Although climbing the 145 stairs to the top for city views may be restricted currently, it remains a popular spot for picnics and hosts sound and light shows from Tuesday to Sunday. Originally built as a storehouse, Golghar now stands as a recreational site drawing both local and international visitors annually.
name: Golghar
address: Opp.-Govt. Girls High school, Ashok Rajpath Rd, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

excerpt: Serene green space featuring a modern Buddhist museum, meditation hall, bodhi trees & a large stupa.
detail_description: Buddha Smriti Park, also known as Buddha Memorial Park, is a serene urban oasis in Bihar. This 22-acre park was developed to celebrate the 2554th Birth Anniversary of Lord Buddha and features a modern Buddhist museum, meditation hall, bodhi trees, and a large stupa at its center.
name: Buddha Smriti Park
address: near Buddha park, Budh Vihar, Fraser Road Area, Patna, Bihar 800020, India

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant Bankipur area of Patna, Padri Ki Haveli is a remarkable church that beautifully showcases the rich tapestry of Bihar's history and culture. Known as the oldest church in the state, it was originally established by Roman Catholics in 1713 and later redesigned by Venetian architect Tirreto in 1772.
name: Padri Ki Haveli
address: near V2, Khaje Kalan, Sadikpur, Patna, Bihar 800008, India

excerpt: Family-friendly place with educational displays & activities, plus a planetarium & 3D theater.
detail_description: Located in Patna, Bihar, Shrikrishna Science Centre is a family-friendly destination offering educational displays and activities for both school children and the local public. Established in 1978, it is dedicated to promoting science education through non-formal means of instruction. The center features models showcasing various branches of science and also includes a planetarium and 3D theater.
name: Shrikrishna Science Centre
address: West Gandhi Maidan, Raja Ji Salai, Dujra Diara, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

detail_description: Gandhi Ghat, situated on the banks of the River Ganga in Patna, is a picturesque tourist spot known for its scenic views and spiritual significance. It is a prominent ghat where Mahatma Gandhi's ashes were immersed, and it hosts the famous Evening Ganga Aarti that draws large crowds daily. The serene ambiance and the sight of 51 diyas lit during the aarti create a spiritually uplifting experience for visitors. Located just 4.
name: Gandhi Ghat
address: Patna, Bihar 800005, India

excerpt: Large, tree-lined field for jogging, recreational cricket & city festivals, with a Gandhi statue.
detail_description: Gandhi Maidan, located in the heart of Patna, Bihar, India, is a sprawling green space with a rich historical significance. This large field has been a witness to numerous political and social events, including the Quit India movement in 1942. Over the years, it has hosted speeches by prominent figures like Mahatma Gandhi and Rajendra Prasad. The area is now used for various purposes such as recreational activities, city festivals, mass prayers, and trade fairs.
name: Gandhi Maidan
address: North -West Area of, Gandhi Maidan Rd, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

detail_description: Agam Kuan, located in Patna, is a significant historical site dating back to the Emperor Maurya Ashoka Period. This ancient well is 105 feet deep and has a diameter of 20.2 feet. To prevent erosion, 44 feet of its depth is lined with bricks. The well also features a brick wall that extends outwards, forming a structure with eight arched windows. It stands as an impressive testament to ancient engineering and architectural prowess.
name: Agam Kuan
address: Patna, Bihar, India

excerpt: Sprawling, modern museum featuring exhibits on the region's history, art & culture.
detail_description: Bihar Museum in Patna is a modern and expansive museum that showcases the rich history, art, and culture of the region. Inaugurated in 2015 as part of an initiative to promote Bihar's cultural heritage, this museum was designed by renowned architect Fumihiko Maki. With 24,000 square meters of space, it offers a diverse collection of treasures from Bihar.
name: Bihar Museum
address: Jawaharlal Nehru Marg, Bailey Rd, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

excerpt: Established in 1919, this private museum features Asian & European art & antiques.
detail_description: Jalan Museum, also known as the Quila House, is a private museum located in Bihar's capital city. Established in 1919, it boasts an extensive collection of over 10,000 Asian and European artifacts and souvenirs.
name: Jalan Museum
address: Quila Rd, Hajiganj, Patna, Bihar 800008, India

excerpt: Kumhrar or Kumrahar is the area of Patna where remains of the ancient city of Pataliputra were excavated by the Archaeological Survey of India starting from 1913. It is located 5 km east of Patna Railway Station. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Kumhrar, also known as Kumrahar, is an archaeological site in Patna where the remains of the ancient city of Pataliputra have been excavated. This area holds great historical significance as it was once part of the Mauryan Empire. Visitors can explore the ruins and gain insight into the glorious history of Pataliputra, offering a fascinating glimpse into India's rich past.
name: Kumhrar
address: Patna, Bihar, India

name: Mahavir Mandir
address: J587+X24, Khazanchi Rd, Lalbagh, Patna, Bihar 800004, India

excerpt: Historic birthplace of the 10th guru of Sikhism, offering worship services & education.
detail_description: Takhat Shri Harimandir Ji Patna Sahib, also known as Patna Sahib Gurudwara, is a significant pilgrimage site for Sikhs. Situated on the banks of the Ganges in Bihar, it is revered for being the birthplace of Guru Gobind Singh, the 10th guru of Sikhism. The gurudwara's magnificent white marble structure showcases impressive Sikh architecture and attracts visitors from all over India.
name: Takhat Shri Harimandir Ji Patna Sahib
address: Takhat, H6WJ+332, Sri harmandir ji, Harimindir Gali, Patna Sahib, Jhauganj, Hajiganj, Patna, Bihar 800008, India

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Patna, the Khuda Bakhsh Oriental Public Library is a treasure trove for book lovers and history enthusiasts alike. Established in 1891 by Khan Bahadur Maulvi Khuda Bakhsh, this remarkable library boasts an impressive collection of over 250,000 books and more than 21,000 manuscripts in languages such as Arabic, Persian, and Sanskrit.
name: Khuda Bakhsh Oriental Public Library
address: Patna University Campus, Patna, Bihar 800004, India

detail_description: Eco Park in Patna is a picturesque recreational area situated along the Ganges River. Visitors can enjoy its verdant surroundings, walking paths, boating options, and breathtaking river vistas. It's an ideal place to relax and rejuvenate amidst natural beauty.
name: Eco park
address: H4X6+3WG, Eco Pk 2, Rajbansi Nagar, Patna, Bihar 800015, India

detail_description: The Mahatma Gandhi Setu, also referred to as the Gandhi Setu, is a newly reconstructed iron bridge that stands as one of Asia's longest river bridges. Spanning across the River Ganges, it connects Patna and Hajipur in Bihar, offering a beautiful and breathtaking view of the surroundings. This iconic bridge serves as a crucial link for transportation and is admired by both locals and tourists for its impressive structure and scenic location.
name: Mahatma Gandhi Setu
address: J652+H24, Mahatma Gandhi Setu, Sadikpur, Patna, Bihar 800007, India

excerpt: Large zoological park & gardens with a pond, a kids' play area & a small train in a lush landscape.
detail_description: Sanjay Gandhi Biological Park, also known as Patna Zoo, is a sprawling zoological park and gardens that opened to the public in 1973. Spanning across a vast expanse of 153 hectares, it is home to over 800 animals from more than 110 species, including rare and endangered ones like the Royal Bengal tiger, chimpanzees, hippopotamus, giraffe, rhinoceros, zebra, crocodile, gharial and leopard.
name: Sanjay Gandhi Biological Park
address: Bailey Rd, Rajbansi Nagar, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

excerpt: Hindu temple founded on one of 51 sites where parts of Devi Sati's corpse are said to have fallen.
detail_description: Shri Badi Patan Devi Temple in Patna is a significant Hindu temple, believed to be one of the 51 Indian Siddha Shakti Pithas. Legend has it that this sacred site is where parts of Devi Sati's corpse fell after Lord Vishnu used Sudarshan Chakra. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Durga and was previously known as Maa Sarvanand Kari Patneshwari.
name: Shri Badi Patan Devi Temple, Patna
address: Sadikpur, Patna, Bihar 800007, India

excerpt: Founded in 1967, this museum explores the life of Mahatma Gandhi via photos, movies & manuscripts.
detail_description: Gandhi Sangrahalaya, also known as Gandhi Museum, is a dedicated museum located near Patna City Centre that offers a deep exploration of the life and teachings of Mahatma Gandhi. Established in 1967, it houses personal belongings, photographs, documents, and audio-visual materials related to his life and legacy. The museum presents a visual biography through photos depicting key moments in Gandhi's journey, along with quotes, models, and memorabilia.
name: Gandhi Sangrahalaya
address: J4CR+9X5, Ashok Raj Path, North, West Gandhi Maidan, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

detail_description: Darbhanga House is a stunning palatial structure located on the banks of the Ganges River in Patna. Originally built by Maharaja Kameshwar Singh of Darbhanga, this architectural marvel combines traditional Mithila design with modern elements, showcasing intricate artwork and reflecting the cultural heritage of the region. The house now houses various departments of Patna University and features sprawling gardens and artistic interiors for visitors to explore.
name: Darbhanga House
address: University University Road, Patna University Campus, Patna, Bihar 800005, India

excerpt: Remains of an ancient temple, monastery & marble assembly hall on public view in a grassy space.
detail_description: Kumhrar Park is a historical site that displays the remnants of ancient Pataliputra, the capital of the Mauryan Empire. The park features ruins such as an 80-pillar hall and the arogyshala of Panini, dating back to the 3rd century BC. These relics are believed to be from Ashoka's reign and are associated with the Third Buddhist Council.
name: Kumhrar Park
address: Kumhrar, Patna, Bihar 800026, India

excerpt: Centuries-old place of worship with stone towers, offering prayers & other religious activities.
detail_description: Patthar Ki Masjid, also known as the Stone Mosque, is a centuries-old place of worship located on the banks of the Ganges River in Patna. Built in 1621 by Parvez Shah, son of Emperor Jahangir, this beautiful mosque is made entirely of stones and stands as one of the few Muslim pilgrimage centers in the city. Adjacent to Har Mandir Sahib, it offers prayers and religious activities for visitors.
name: Patthar Ki Masjid
address: Ashok Rajpath Rd, Tripolia, Patna, Bihar 800006, India

detail_description: Patan Devi Temple, also known as Maa Patneshwari Mandir, is one of the oldest and most renowned temples in Patna. It is considered to be one of the 51 Siddha Shakti Pithas in India, with a history and legend that dates back to the belief that it was where the right thigh of Devi Sati fell. Visitors often describe it as a lovely and peaceful place surrounded by beautiful nature.
name: Patan Devi Temple Gujrati Samaj
address: Buddh Marg, Fraser Road Area, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

excerpt: Patna is an ancient city that sprawls along the south bank of the Ganges River in Bihar, northeast India. The state capital, its home to Bihar Museum, a contemporary landmark exhibiting bronze sculptures and old coins from the region. Nearby, Indo-Saracenicstyle Patna Museum displays a casket believed to contain the Buddhas ashes. Close to the river, the Golghar is a domed colonial granary overlooking the city.
detail_description: Patna, a historic city situated on the southern bank of the Ganges River in Bihar, northeastern India, is known for its cultural and historical landmarks. The Bihar Museum showcases ancient artifacts such as bronze sculptures and coins, while the Patna Museum houses a casket believed to hold Buddha's ashes. Overlooking the city is Golghar, a colonial granary with a domed structure.
name: Patna
address: Bihar, India

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant city of Patna, the Indira Gandhi Planetarium, affectionately known as Taramandal or Patna Planetarium, stands as one of Asia's largest and oldest planetariums. This remarkable venue is a treasure trove for astronomy enthusiasts and curious minds alike. Visitors can immerse themselves in captivating exhibits that delve into the mysteries of galaxies and celestial phenomena.
name: Indira Gandhi Planetarium
address: J46J+4Q4, Jawaharlal Nehru Marg, Adalatganj, Kidwaipuri, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

excerpt: Vibrant Hindu temple in a commercial area & adjacent to Patna Junction railway station.
detail_description: The Sri Mahavir Mandir is a lively Hindu temple located in a commercial area near the Patna Junction railway station. Considered one of the most renowned temples in Bihar, it was established by Swami Balanand, a follower of the Ramanandi Sect, around 1730AD. This temple showcases various idols including Lord Hanuman, Lord Krishna and Arjun, deities from the Shiva family, Lord Ganesh, Lord Buddha, and goddess Durga.
name: Mahavir Mandir Patna
address: J43P+HXM, Near, Patna Jct, Budh Vihar, Fraser Road Area, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

detail_description: Gol Ghar is a must-see historical site with a nearby park, making it an ideal destination for history enthusiasts and nature lovers alike.

detail_description: Maurya Lok Complex in Patna is a well-maintained shopping and entertainment destination with a wide variety of stores and restaurants. Its central location makes it easily accessible from many parts of the city, with ample parking available. The complex offers a spacious environment that remains navigable even during peak hours.
name: Maurya Lok Complex
address: Morya Lok Complex, 25/26 A, New Dak Bunglow Rd, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

detail_description: Gurdwara Handi Sahib is located in Danapur, a cantonment station 20 km west of old Patna City. It holds historical significance as the place where Guru Tegh Bahadur's family made their first halt after leaving Patna Sahib. The shrine was named Handiwali Sangat after an old lady served a kettleful of khichari to them.
name: Gurudwara Handi Sahib
address: Awasthi Ghat, Danapur Nizamat, Patna, Bihar 800012, India

excerpt: Phulwari or Phulwari Sharif is Block and town in Patna district in the Indian state of Bihar. It is included in the Patna Metropolitan Region and is one of the fastest growing area of urban Patna. The civilisation of the city dates back to the days of inception of the Sufi culture in India. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Phulwari Sharif, a town in the Patna district of Bihar, is part of the rapidly growing urban area within the Patna Metropolitan Region. This historical city has deep roots in Sufi culture and is home to a renowned mosque and shrine, including that of Hazrat Pir Muzibullah Quadri. The spiritual atmosphere and stunning architecture make it a popular destination for both devotees and tourists seeking a peaceful escape.
name: Phulwari Sharif
address: Patna, Bihar, India

excerpt: Altars to 3 Hindu deities with 84 surrounding pillars in a vast structure built through the 2010s.
detail_description: The ISKCON Temple in Patna, also known as the International Society of Krishna Consciousness, is a new addition to the group and is still under construction. Once completed, it will be the largest complex in the Bihar-Jharkhand area. The temple features stunning white and red architecture and houses altars dedicated to three Hindu deities along with 84 surrounding pillars.
name: ISKCON Temple Patna
address: J44M+Q6M, Golok Dham, Buddh Marg, Adalatganj, Veerchand Patel Road Area, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

excerpt: North Indian & Chinese staples served in a rooftop revolving restaurant with city views.
detail_description: Pind The Revolving Restaurant is a unique dining spot located on the 18th floor of Biskoman Bhawan, just 1 km from Patna City Centre. It features advanced German technology that allows the entire restaurant to revolve slowly, offering panoramic views of Patna during a meal. With North Indian and Chinese cuisine on offer, guests can enjoy their favorite dishes while taking in the cityscape. The restaurant's rotating feature provides an ever-changing view of Patna's landmarks and attractions.
name: Pind The Revolving Restaurant
address: Biscomaun Bhawan, 16th, 17th & 18th, Gandhi Maidan Rd, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

It offers a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of urban life with its blossoming flowers, water fountains, playground, and exercise equipment. The park is popular among early morning joggers and students who frequent the area. With wheelchair access and parking facilities available, it provides a clean and well-maintained environment for visitors to enjoy.
name: S.K.Puri Park

detail_description: The High Court is a historic and architecturally impressive building located in the heart of the city. It serves as the highest court of law in the region, handling important legal matters and cases. The grandeur of the High Court's interior and exterior design reflects its significance in upholding justice. Visitors can explore the courtrooms and learn about its rich history through guided tours or educational exhibits.
name: High Court
address: Kidwaipuri, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

detail_description: Gurudwara Shri Guru Ka Bagh Sahib is located in the Dhaulpura Area of Patna City and holds great historical significance. It is believed that this is where Guru Teg Bahadur Ji met his son, Guru Gobind Singh Ji for the first time. The lush greenery here is said to have appeared when Guru Teg Bahadur put his feet on the barren land.

excerpt: Ornate Sikh temple featuring domes, a fountain & a courtyard, plus night accommodation for pilgrims.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Patna Sahib, Gurdwara Bal Leela Maini Sangat is a stunning Sikh temple that holds deep historical significance as the childhood playground of Guru Gobind Singh. This ornate gurdwara features magnificent domes, a tranquil fountain, and an inviting courtyard that creates a serene atmosphere for reflection and prayer. The architecture beautifully marries traditional Sikh elements with modern touches, making it not only a spiritual haven but also an architectural marvel.
name: Gurdwara Bal Leela Maini Sangat
address: H6VH+5RC, Patna Sahib, Hajiganj, Patna, Bihar 800008, India
